block.p: BOSTON CO. ASSET MANAGEMENT, Boston, a unit of Mellon Bank Corp., named Francis Antin chief executive. Mr. Antin, formerly vice chairman and chief operating officer, joined the company in November 1995 from State Street Bank and Trust.
GILLETTE CO., Boston, named Gian Camuzzi vice president and treasurer effective July 1, succeeding Lloyd Swaim, who is retiring.

BOSTON CO. ASSET MANAGEMENT, Boston, a unit of Mellon Bank Corp., named Francis Antin chief executive. Mr. Antin, formerly vice chairman and chief operating officer, joined the company in November 1995 from State Street Bank and Trust.
GILLETTE CO., Boston, named Gian Camuzzi vice president and treasurer effective July 1, succeeding Lloyd Swaim, who is retiring.

PAINE WEBBER GROUP INC., New York, named Michael F. O'Hanlon, managing director, head of its London-based international fixed-income offices. Alison Cottrell will replace Mr. O'Hanlon as chief international economist.
